I had expected an Infernal mana font to be hotter to the touch, but the stone remains quite cool.
Pay no mind to the whispers emanating from this Void mana font.  The creatures of the beyond answer to my will, not the other way around.
Peace and harmony, overflowing.  This Hallowed font is but a shadow of greater beauty.
primalmagick.research.heavenly_mana_font: It is wisdom to leave the world in a better state than one found it.  Someday, one will walk in my footsteps seeking the secrets of magick.  I should leave them with better tools than were left to me.
My latest creations will ensure that those who come after me have a plentiful supply of mana to work from.  These fonts hold ten times as much mana as the last iteration.
The method of my discovery of Blood magick still haunts me.  I should ensure that my successors don't have to experience that by leaving them a source of Blood mana.
I would not wish a trip to the Nether on anyone.  Perhaps it is for the best that I leave behind a source of Infernal mana.
The way to the End is truly daunting, and its denizens most dangerous.  Those learning should not have to risk their lives.  I will leave them a source of Void mana.
Beautiful is the song of the universe.  Its harmony should be shared with all, and share I shall with this font of Hallowed mana.
primalmagick.research.mana_arrows.title: Mana-Tinged Arrows
primalmagick.research.mana_arrows.text.s:
I have some mana and I have an arcane workbench. I want to make something cool, something useful, but my knowlege is still so limited.
What if I channel a bit of mana into my weapons to help me hunt? The mana binding techniques I have are still flimsy, though, so the weaving wouldn't last long. Very limited in how often they could be used.
Hmm, what about arrows?

Well this worked out nicely. With a pinch of essence dust, I'm able to tinge the heads of some arrows with mana. It's not much, but it's enough to give them a limited secondary effect when fired.
Earth arrows carry the weight of stone with them, knocking the target back a little.
Sea arrows hinder the target with cold, slowing them down. They also fly true underwater.
Sky arrows sail freely on the skies, unhindered by gravity so long as they're in the air. That will make for some great sharpshooting.
Sun arrows turn the target into a glowing beacon. They also combust on contact with the undead, lighting them on fire briefly.
Moon arrows sap the strength of the target, weakening them a little briefly.
primalmagick.research.mana_arrows.text.a: Blood arrows live up to their name, causing the target to bleed excessively for a short time, doing further damage.  Curiously, they also fly true underwater.
Infernal arrows burst into flame as soon as they're launched, igniting anything they hit.
Void arrows inflict a withering effect on the target briefly, doing further damage.
Hallowed arrows simply do more damage on impact than normal arrows.  They also cause the undead to combust briefly.
I think I'm starting to get the hang of Runeworking. Certain symbols carry inherent magickal power. By carving them into stone, then inscribing the right combination of them onto an item, I can imbue that item with an effect much like an enchantment.
While somewhat invovled, there appear to be a number of benefits to this process over using an enchanting table.
First, it doesn't cost me any of my hard-won experience. That alone makes it worth studying.
Second, I have full control of the enchantment that gets applied. No more praying for the right random result at the enchanting table.
And third, I can actually apply runes to an item that I've already enchanted for further effect.
This process has its drawbacks, though. These runes are very complicated; I'm going to have to research each of them individually to make sure I get them right. And an item can only have one set of runes applied to it at a time. Finally, and most strangely, while a standard grindstone will remove the magick that the runes impart, it won't remove the runes themselves, so I can't apply new ones.
Still, this is a discipline that seems well worth my time to pursue, if I want to give myself the arms and armor I need to survive.
primalmagick.research.expert_runeworking: My skill with runeworking is growing, but I need more practice with it before I can get over this plateau I'm on.  Nothing to do but keep at it.

I now feel comfortable calling myself an expert at carving and scribing runes. Now I can start researching more advanced runes and continue my experimentation.
In addition, I've devised an upgraded runescribing altar that will allow me to scribe more runes onto a single item at a time. This means that it's now possible to have multiple rune enchantments on an item simultaneously, assuming I can find a set that overlap a little.
primalmagick.research.master_runeworking: My skill with runeworking is growing, but I need more practice with it before I can get over this plateau I'm on.  Nothing to do but keep at it.

I've now mastered conventional runeworking and have started researching the forbidden topics that my Grimoire remains silent about.
I've also once again upgraded my runescribing altar to allow for scribing more runes onto an item. This will make it even easier to make additional rune combinations.
primalmagick.research.supreme_runeworkin: The top of the hill is in sight.  My skills with runeworking are almost without peer...  Almost.

The most advanced topics in the discipline of runeworking are now at my fingertips.
And at last, I have perfected my runescribing altar. It will allow me to scribe the most possible runes onto an item at once, allowing for easy combinations to be made.
primalmagick.research.rune_earth.title: Rune: Earth
primalmagick.research.rune_earth.text.st: Source runes are a critical component of forming rune combinations.  I should figure out how to attune a rune to the Earth.
A little Earth dust and an unattuned rune, and presto!  One Earth rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_sea.title: Rune: Sea
primalmagick.research.rune_sea.text.stag: Source runes are a critical component of forming rune combinations.  I should figure out how to attune a rune to the Sea.
Attuning a Sea rune is a simple matter of combining an unattuned rune with some Sea dust.
primalmagick.research.rune_sky.title: Rune: Sky
primalmagick.research.rune_sky.text.stag: Source runes are a critical component of forming rune combinations.  I should figure out how to attune a rune to the Sky.
Combining an unattuned rune with some Sky dust will yield a usable Sky rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_sun.title: Rune: Sun
primalmagick.research.rune_sun.text.stag: Source runes are a critical component of forming rune combinations.  I should figure out how to attune a rune to the Sun.
Just take some Sun dust and an unattuned rune, and you've got yourself a Sun rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_moon.title: Rune: Moon
primalmagick.research.rune_moon.text.sta: Source runes are a critical component of forming rune combinations.  I should figure out how to attune a rune to the Moon.
Unattuned rune?  Check.  Moon dust?  Check.  Crafting table?  Check.  That's a Moon rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_project.title: Rune: Project
To form a valid rune combination, I'll need access to Verb runes.  Perhaps the Grimoire can point me towards one.
To energize or bring about.  This rune's meaning can be interpreted a number of ways, but those are the most common.  When I want to take something and cast it outward, I want a Project rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_protect.title: Rune: Protect
To form a valid rune combination, I'll need access to Verb runes.  Perhaps the Grimoire can point me towards one.
This rune's meaning is pretty straightforward.  It guards and preserves whatever it's bound to.
primalmagick.research.rune_item.title: Rune: Item
primalmagick.research.rune_item.text.sta: To form a valid rune combination, I'll need access to Noun runes.  Perhaps the Grimoire can point me towards one.
When I want the effect of the rune enchantment to affect the piece of gear it's on, that's a job for an Item rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_self.title: Rune: Self
primalmagick.research.rune_self.text.sta: To form a valid rune combination, I'll need access to Noun runes.  Perhaps the Grimoire can point me towards one.
To have a rune enchantment affect myself, I should use a Self rune in the combination.
primalmagick.research.rune_blood.title: Rune: Blood
primalmagick.research.rune_blood.text.st: The forbidden sources must have runes too, it only makes sense.  I must attune one to the Blood!
Child's play.  Combining an unattuned rune with a handful of Blood dust attuned the rune perfectly.
primalmagick.research.rune_infernal.text: The forbidden sources must have runes too, it only makes sense.  I must attune one to the Infernal!
It was trivially easy to attune an Infernal rune.  I needed only introduce an unattuned rune to some Infernal dust, and the magick practically worked itself.
primalmagick.research.rune_void.title: Rune: Void
primalmagick.research.rune_void.text.sta: The forbidden sources must have runes too, it only makes sense.  I must attune one to the Void!
An unattuned rune will drink up Void dust as easily as any other source.
primalmagick.research.rune_absorb.title: Rune: Absorb
primalmagick.research.rune_absorb.text.s: More types of Verb runes will open up more rune combination possibilities.  I should attempt to discover some.
This rune is sort of the opposite of the Project rune.  It pulls in and binds, rather than casting out.
primalmagick.research.rune_dispel.title: Rune: Dispel
primalmagick.research.rune_dispel.text.s: More types of Verb runes will open up more rune combination possibilities.  I should attempt to discover some.
To destroy or unmake, that is the purview of the Dispel rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_summon.title: Rune: Summon
primalmagick.research.rune_summon.text.s: More types of Verb runes will open up more rune combination possibilities.  I should attempt to discover some.
Another rune with a largely apparent meaning.  The Summon rune takes from somewhere else, and brings that something here.
primalmagick.research.rune_area.title: Rune: Area
primalmagick.research.rune_area.text.sta: More types of Noun runes will open up more rune combination possibilities.  I should attempt to discover some.
If I want a rune enchantment to affect more than a single target, I will probably need an Area rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_creature.text: More types of Noun runes will open up more rune combination possibilities.  I should attempt to discover some.
Trickier than it seems, the Creature rune affects neither the items it's scribed upon nor its wielder, but another being altogether.
primalmagick.research.rune_hallowed.text: Does the Hallowed possess a rune as well?  Can the song of the universe be captured in a glyph?
While it's a pale shadow of the universe's blessing, combining a handful of Hallowed dust with an unattuned rune will indeed produce a Hallowed rune.
primalmagick.research.rune_power.title: Rune: Power
primalmagick.research.rune_power.text.st: Rune enchantments are very convenient, but they're rarely as powerful as the output of an enchanting table.  I will not be limited in this way!

Fascinating... A type of rune that is neither Verb nor Noun nor Source.
A Power rune can be added to any other rune combination to increase the level of the resulting enchantment. I can even use multiple Power runes to augment it further, although any given enchantment can only be amplified so far.
The best part is that a single Power rune will bolster all rune combinations I'm inscribing, rather than just one of them.
Truly my genius knows no bounds!
primalmagick.research.runic_grindstone.t: There must be a way to remove runes from an item if I'm not satisfied with the result.  It's just so weird that I can't!

The grindstone already does the job I want it to, almost. It just needs a little help.
By inscribing Dispel runes onto the faces of the grindstone during its construction, I can allow it to purge runes completely. It will be as if the item had never been inscribed.
primalmagick.research.basic_ritual.title: Basic Ritual Magick
I think I'm starting to get the hang of Ritual Magick. It's like cooking a recipe.
First, you assemble your ingredients. Then you stage everything in the right place. And then you follow each step exactly as written at the appointed time.
There's just a slightly higher chance of something exploding if you do it wrong.
I need several things in order to conduct a ritual. First and most important is the central altar. This serves as the focal point of the ritual, around which everything else is arrayed, both physically and metaphysically.
Next come the offering pedestals, arrayed around the altar. It's on these that I place the ingredients for the ritual. Having more pedestals than I need doesn't hurt, but they might get a little in the way.
Thirdly, all rituals require props of some kind, placed near the altar. I'll come back to these in a bit.
Finally, I need refined salt, and lots of it. Every block that's part of the ritual, be it a prop or an offering pedestal, must be connected to the central altar by an unbroken line of salt. No salt, no mystical connection, bad times.
To start a ritual, I must first identify what ingredients and props it needs. These will be listed in the Grimoire entry for each ritual. Once identified, I array the pedestals and props around the altar, ensuring a salt connection. Symmetry is important in this placement, and will contribute to a successful ritual. I then place each of the ingredients on a separate pedestal and, once I'm ready to begin, wave my wand at the central altar.
Once started, an orb of energy will appear above the altar. This orb is a sort of status indicator for the ritual's stability.
Right, stability.
Ritual magick is dangerous, and rituals destabilize the longer they go on. Too much instability buildup, and mishaps can happen. That's bad, potentially disastrous. The more red that orb over the altar is, the more unstable the ritual has become. On the other hand, if it turns green, that means I'm doing a good job keeping the instability in check. All rituals will destabilize over time proportionately to their instability rating, but other things can affect it as well. The symmetry that I mentioned earlier? Asymmetrical ritual setups will destabilize faster. Using too much salt will also cause destabilization, as it grounds out the magick.
Anyway, as the ritual progresses, the central altar will absorb the offerings I've placed on the pedestals. At certain points, though, the ritual will pause and demand that I interact with one of the ritual's props. This is the most dangerous time in a ritual, as instability will be mounting while no progress is being made. Once the prop interaction is complete, the ritual will resume progress, with an added burst of stability. Precisely how I need to interact with a prop will be detailed in its Grimoire entry.
Once all of the offerings have been absorbed and all of the props have been interacted with, the ritual will end and the end result will appear on the central altar for me to claim.
Should I feel at any point that a ritual is spiraling beyond my control, I can abort the ritual by waving my wand at the altar a second time. This may have consequences, depending on the built-up instability, but that's better than letting it continue indefinitely.
primalmagick.research.expert_ritual.text: My skill with ritual magick is growing, but I need more practice with it before I can get over this plateau I'm on.  Nothing to do but keep at it.
I now feel comfortable calling myself an expert at conducting rituals.  Now I can start researching more advanced rituals and continue my studies.
primalmagick.research.master_ritual.text: My skill with ritual magick is growing, but I need more practice with it before I can get over this plateau I'm on.  Nothing to do but keep at it.
I've now mastered conventional ritual magick and have started researching the forbidden topics that my Grimoire remains silent about.
primalmagick.research.supreme_ritual.tex: The top of the hill is in sight.  My skills with ritual magick are almost without peer...  Almost.
The most advanced topics in the discipline of ritual magick are now at my fingertips.
primalmagick.research.ritual_candles.tex: I'm going to need special props in order to conduct my rituals.  According to my Grimoire, ritual candles are a classic.  I should figure out what makes them special, compared to ordinary candles.

Apparently there's a special sanctification process that goes into the preparation of ritual candles.
It requires the intonation of special blessings while handling the tallow, and the inscription of mystical sigils. No mana, though.
There's nothing stopping me from using them as tasteful decoration, either, and they come in a wide variety of colors.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I must light it with a flint and steel. It's very important that the candle not already be lit when I start the ritual; the sparking of new light is symbolic.
To reset the prop, I can just snuff it with my fingertips.
It seems that ritual candles can be made from beeswax in addition to tallow.  The sanctification process is the same, so I need not alter my process, just the materials I use.
primalmagick.research.incense_brazier.te: I'm going to need special props in order to conduct my rituals.  According to my Grimoire, incense is commonly used.

Incense can be created from most types of flowers, simply burn it on the end of a stick. The brazier it's burned in, however, must be specially sanctified before use.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I simply take a stick of incense and add it to an unlit brazier. It's very important that the brazier not already be lit when I start the ritual.
To reset the prop, I just remove the charred incense stick with an empty hand.
primalmagick.research.manafruit.title: Manafruit
primalmagick.research.manafruit.text.sta:
My first real ritual! I'm so excited.
I'm piecing together the props and offerings I'll need from my Grimoire's hints. I'll be ready to try it soon!

Fruit? Huh, okay then.
It looks like it's not just any old fruit, though. In addition to being nourishing, this Manafruit will temporarily allow me to channel mana more efficiently, resulting in a slight discount in all my mana costs.
Maybe I can find some other use for it as well?
primalmagick.research.ritual_lectern.tex:
More advanced rituals will require more advanced props to drive them.
Books are symbolic of knowledge and are important in mundane enchanting. Perhaps they can be of use in rituals as well?

Not just any book will do for a ritual, and I can't just be carrying it on my person. After all, I need my hands free in order to conduct the ritual.
To be useful for a ritual, the book must be enchanted first at an enchanting table. The precise enchantment on the book doesn't matter, it just needs to be carrying the magickal energies that come with experience.
As for holding the book, I'll need a specially constructed and sanctified lectern. Moonwood should do nicely for this.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I simply place the enchanted book upon it. It's very important that the lectern be empty when I start the ritual; the surrendering of knowledge is symbolic.
To reset the prop, I just retrieve the book with an empty hand.
primalmagick.research.ritual_bell.title: Ritual Bell
primalmagick.research.ritual_bell.text.s:
More advanced rituals will require more advanced props to drive them.
The pendulous motion of a bell is symbolic of the extremes of good and evil, and its sound a symbol of creative power. Perhaps they can be of use in rituals as well?

I can't just waltz into the nearest village, steal their bell, and expect it to work for my rituals. To capture a pure enough tone, the bell must be constructed of a magickal metal, and must be specially sanctified during construction.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I need only ring it. My hands don't even need to be empty.
Unlike most props, a ritual bell does not need to be manually reset. However, it must have finished its first ring before it can be activated again.
primalmagick.research.bloodletter.title: Bloodletter
primalmagick.research.bloodletter.text.s:
Mere physical props will not be sufficient for rituals of the caliber I now seek to perform.
Blood is life, and life is magick. It would be foolhardy not to try to incorporate blood into my rituals somehow.

As with most props, the effective ritual shedding of blood is not so simple. It must be shed by a blade of purest diamod and collected in a bowl of specially sanctified smoked marble.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I must slice my palm open on the blade and allow the blood to be caught in the bowl. Obviously, this will hurt and do a small amount of damage to me, but it's nothing I can't handle.
To reset the prop, I must wash it clean with a bucket of water.
primalmagick.research.soul_anvil.title: Soul Anvil
primalmagick.research.soul_anvil.text.st:
Mere physical props will not be sufficient for rituals of the caliber I now seek to perform.
Living creatures carry a great deal of energy inside them, often colloquially refered to as a soul. While it would be foolish to try to use my own, the sacrifice of this energy could greatly empower my rituals.
But how best to release it?

The solution here is a straightforward one: brute force. After capturing a soul in a gem, I simply shatter the gem during the ritual at the appropriate time.
But what to shatter it on? These things are sturdy, after all. The answer, I believe, is an anvil specially constructed of Hexium and sanctified with magickal power.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I must take a soul gem in hand and shatter it upon the anvil. It's very important that the anvil be clean when I start the ritual; it wouldn't do to mix shards of different soul gems.
To reset the prop, I must wipe it clean with a piece of magickal cloth.
primalmagick.research.celestial_harp.tex: I can feel the song of the universe flowing through me, and I know that it is the key to unlocking the greatest of magicks.  I must channel it during a ritual, but how?

Mundane instruments are not up to the task of channeling the song. I must construct a new one, made of the finest hallowed wood, and specially sanctified.
To activate this prop during a ritual, I must play it with an empty hand. The fragment of song I channel will last for several seconds, but the ritual will continue once the first notes are played.
Unlike most props, a celestial harp does not need to be manually reset. However, it must have finished playing its first song before it can be activated again.
primalmagick.research.wand_core_primal.t:
The cores that I've discovered so far are potent, but there are only so many wands that a mage can carry!
I wonder if I can combine their power, somehow?

Combining the effects of these wand cores was no mean feat, but I think I've done it! By taking each of the source-aligned wands cores and offering them up in a ritual with some mana salts, I've managed to fuse them into a single wand core with the power of all five.
This core is aligned to all five terrestrial sources, meaning that it will provide the expected discount with Earth, Sea, Sky, Sun, or Moon magick, and will slowly regenerate mana of any of the five sources. In addition, it can be inscribed with two spells, regardless of source.

The process seems to work for creating magickal staves as well. I simply start the ritual offering staff cores instead of wand cores.
As with all staves, it can be inscribed with double the normal amount of spells, for a total of four, regardless of source.
primalmagick.research.wand_core_dark_pri: I am not content with having to use three separate wands to efficiently channel my so-called forbidden magick.  The process I used to create a primal wand core must be replicated for these sources!

The ritual is dangerous, but the risk is worth the reward.
By offering up a primal wand core, along with the three forbidden wand cores and more mana salts, I have created a core worthy of my power.
The core remains aligned to all five terrestrial sources, but is also aligned to the three forbidden sources. It will provide the expected mana discount and regeneration for all eight sources. In addition, a Dark Primal wand core can be inscribed with three spells, regardless of source.

Like expected, the ritual will also create a Dark Primal staff core, assuming that I use staff cores to start out with.
As with all staves, it can be inscribed with double the normal amount of spells, for a total of six, regardless of source.
primalmagick.research.wand_core_pure_pri: Can the universe's love be crafted into a wand?  There's only one way to find out.

Enlightenment made manifest, this wand shall be a tool to work wonders to share with the world.
This core is aligned to all of the primal sources, including the Hallowed. It will provide the expected discount for all magickal workings, and slowly regenerate all sources of mana. In addition, a Pure Primal wand core can be inscribed with four spells, regardless of source.

As with the other wand core types, a Pure Primal staff core may be created as well.
As with all staves, it can be inscribed with double the normal amount of spells, for a total of eight, regardless of source.
primalmagick.research.pixies.title: Pixies
It gets a little lonely, living the life of a mage. Always studying, so few people to talk to who can understand my work.
I wonder if there are any magickal life forms out there that would like to make friends?

Well, it turns out that you can in fact summon friends from the aether. Fascinating!
These little folk call themselves pixies, and have apparently sworn loyalty to me? Something about the ritual I used to summon them seems to bind them to me. I've tried to release them from this bond, but they just swear fealty all over again! Oh well.
In any case, these little ones will follow me around and keep me company, though only three will follow me at any one time. Should I tire of their flitting, I can just grab them with an empty hand and stick them in my pocket or something, they don't seem to mind.
Their attention spans are a little short, but if I get in a fight, they're suddenly all business. They don't like fisticuffs, due to their size, but what they will do is support me with spells! Their magickal nature means they can call upon the sources innately instead of having to channel mana like I do. I'm a little jealous.
Earth pixies will attack with the magick of the land, doing damage and knocking their targets back.
Sea pixies use frost magick, dealing damage and slowing their opponents to a crawl.
Sky pixies use lightning. It doesn't have any secondary effects, but I believe in them!
Sun pixies don't attack at all; instead they heal me of my wounds!
Finally, Moon pixies attack with lunar magick, dealing damage and weakening their targets.
primalmagick.research.pixies.text.addend: It turns out that Blood pixies exist too.  Their magick tears at the target from the inside, bypassing any armor it may be wearing.

Infernal pixies are crazy! The don't cast spells, no, that would be too simple. Instead, they charge their targets like maniacs and explode.
This means they don't stick around for long, but fortunately they seem to take less essence to summon than other pixies.

As for Void pixies, talk about menacing. They have sharp teeth and are always muttering about how hungry they are.
Their magick leaves a consumptive withering effect on their targets.
Hallowed pixies don't say much, but they're very good listeners.  They also don't like the undead much; their magick does double damage to any undead creature they hit.
primalmagick.research.grand_pixies.title: Grand Pixies
The pixies that I've summoned seem to have a strict social hierarchy. I can tell because they're always complaining about being at the bottom of it.
I should see about binding their superiors to my service. Surely their magick will be superior.

These new pixies that I've summoned, grand pixies, seem to be knights of a sort.
As defenders of whatever realm they hail from, they possess superior magick to the lesser pixies that I've been summoning until now. They also come bearing pixie-sized armor, granting them a little more endurance than their predecessors.
The types of magick that these grand pixies use has not changed, only become stronger.
Blood pixies have knights too, and their magick is most effective at rending my foes from the inside.
Grand Infernal pixies still explode, and they explode bigger than ever.  Note to self: don't be too close to anything they're angry at.
This superior cadre of Void pixie can cause a zombie to wither away in mere moments.  They will make useful tools.
The warrior-poets of their kind, grand Hallowed pixies are on a never-ending crusade against the undead.
primalmagick.research.majestic_pixies.te:
At times, I can't help but overhear my grand pixie cohorts talk about their lieges. Their real lieges, that is, not me.
Their kind is so fascinating. I would very much like to meet pixie royalty.

They answered my call! These kings and queens of pixie-dom are truly majestic in their visage, and their power is unrivaled among their kind.
Surprisingly, they have agreed to work with me as well. Not for a bond of fealty, but as a companionship of equals. Apparently their subjects have spoken of me, and the rulers were impressed by what they heard.
These majestic pixies wield their innate power with the skill of magi; their spells are even more potent than that of their knights. I expect I will not be disappointed with their prowess in combat.
The rulers of the Blood pixies can practically turn a zombie inside-out with a thought.  Disturbing, but undeniably effective.

So this is where all those Infernal pixies learned it from.  Majestic Infernal pixies pack the biggest boom of them all.  One wonders why royalty would be so eager to explode, but apparently it's considered a sign of strength where they come from.
Majestic Void pixies strike with all the consumptive wrath of the Wither itself.
These paragons of the Hallowed speak rarely, but what words they do share are filled with wisdom.  That and curses for the undead.
primalmagick.research.ambrosia.title: Ambrosia
primalmagick.research.ambrosia.text.stag:
So far, I've learned that there are two types of magickal attunement: permanent and temporary. Permanent attunement comes from learning new secrets, and temporary comes from channeling mana.
Both of these have drawbacks, however. Secrets take a long time to learn for permanent attunement, and there are only so many of them out there. And temporary attunement is just that: temporary. I must continue channeling mana of that source, or that attunement will fade.
I wonder if there's another method with which I can induce an attunement to a source?

So this is why the Grimoire was hinting at me about Manafruit. It's the key to my attunement!
By performing the right ritual, I can transform Manafruit into a substance I've come to call Ambrosia. Eating ambrosia will induce a small amount of attunement within me to the source with which it's aligned.
There are two limits to ambrosia that I've been able to determine. First, I can only induce a small amount of attunement using it; beyond that it just won't work. And second, attuning myself to one source will de-attune me to all of the others to a lesser degree.
Still, this may be the secret to unlocking greater levels of primal attunement for myself!
primalmagick.research.ambrosia.text.adde: Blood ambrosia exists, and it tastes unnervingly salty.
Infernal ambrosia has a fiery aftertaste.
Void ambrosia... it feels like it's eating me.  I don't want to think about it.
The taste of Hallowed ambrosia reminds me of my very favorite things.
primalmagick.research.greater_ambrosia.t: There must be more to ambrosia than this.  I covet the power that comes with greater attunement, and I will have it!

I was right, of course. By adjusting the ritual with more powerful offerings, I can create a greater version of ambrosia.
This greater ambrosia will still induce attunement at the same slow rate as before, but I will be able to keep using it for significantly longer before it stops having effect.
Blood ambrosia exists, and it tastes unnervingly salty.
Infernal ambrosia has a fiery aftertaste.
Void ambrosia... it feels like it's eating me.  I don't want to think about it.
The taste of Hallowed ambrosia reminds me of my very favorite things.
primalmagick.research.supreme_ambrosia.t: I have learned some of the secrets of the universe, but can I attune myself to it more deeply?

The song of the universe blesses me once more. It has revealed how I may create a supreme ambrosia with my ritual magick.
Supreme ambrosia will allow me to induce the maximum possible attunement for a source, though it won't do it any faster.
Blood ambrosia exists, and it tastes unnervingly salty.
Infernal ambrosia has a fiery aftertaste.
Void ambrosia... it feels like it's eating me.  I don't want to think about it.
The taste of Hallowed ambrosia reminds me of my very favorite things.
primalmagick.research.flying_carpet.text: As a mage of great power, I deserve to ride in style.  No mere horse for me.  Let's make that happen.

The skies are mine! I have animated a mere swatch of carpet into a fantastic flying vehicle, and I didn't even need to use forbidden magick to do it.
The Flying Carpet has a small semblance of animal intelligence and will respond to my commands when I sit on it. I need only direct it forward, as I would an animal or minecart, and it will fly in the direction I'm looking, left, right, up or down. I can direct it backwards as well, but that is much slower. Once I'm done flying, I can pick the carpet back up by using it while sneaking.
And let's not forget about style! While it certainly looks lovely in white, I can also change the carpet to one of a wide variety of colors by combining it with a colored dye. Should I wish to undo the coloring, I can wash it off in a cauldron.
primalmagick.research.cleansing_rite.tex: I've committed many sins in my pursuit of magick.  While I have gained great power, those sins have begun to weigh upon me.  But what to do about it?

I magicked my way into this problem, and I will magick my way back out.
I've devised a ritual that will collect and congeal the negative energy of my sins, allowing me to manifest them in physical form. This alone will not free me, however, as they will remain metaphysically bound to me unless I face and overcome them.
But thanks to magick, that may be possible without undergoing years of therapy. If I bind this negative energy to a Sanguine Core, I can use a crucible to spawn a manifestation of those sins and defeat it in combat! Unorthodox, but it just might work.
Unless it kills me, of course. I should be very clear on that: I don't know what exactly will come out of that crucible, but it will be very powerful and very, very angry. I had best be prepared for a difficult fight.
primalmagick.research.primal_shovel.text: I wonder if I can improve my tools by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  The Earth seems to make the most sense for a shovel, so let's try that.

Ritually aligning a primalite shovel to the Earth has yielded a digging tool par excellence.
When used to dig soil, sand, snow, or the like, it will excavate a full 5x5 area worth of blocks, oriented along the face that I dug. If I wish to suppress this property, I just have to dig while sneaking.
The shovel doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this shovel's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining Project, Area, and Earth runes, I can apply this enchantment to any digging tool to increase its area of effect.
primalmagick.research.primal_fishing_rod: I wonder if I can improve my tools by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  A fishing rod is the obvious match to the Sea, so I'm going to try that.

Ritually aligning a primalite fishing rod to the Sea has created a bringer of abundance.
When used to fish up items from the water, I stand a good chance to receive more items per catch. Curiously, it also seems to yield more items when harvesting crops.
The fishing rod doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this fishing rod's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining Summon, Area, and Sea runes, I can apply this enchantment to any fishing rod or hoe to increase yields.
primalmagick.research.primal_axe.title: Primal Axe
primalmagick.research.primal_axe.text.st: I wonder if I can improve my tools by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  There doesn't seem to be a good fit for the Sky, though...  Then again, lightning strikes trees all the time, right?  Maybe an axe will work.

Ritually aligning a primalite axe to the Sky has resulted in a very destructive tool.
When used to break a block, the power of the axe will arc through every adjacent block of the same type, harvesting those blocks as well. Then it will arc through the blocks adjacent to those, and so on, breaking every like block in that cluster. Thankfully, it seems to have an upper limit of how much it will break, otherwise that could get awkward.
If I wish to suppress this property, I just have to chop while sneaking.
The axe doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.
primalmagick.research.primal_axe.text.ad:
I've learned how to recreate this axe's special properties using a rune enchantment. By combining Project, Area, and Sky runes, I can apply this enchantment to any digging tool to allow it to harvest whole trees or mineral veins. Or, well, clusters of anything else.
I should be careful where I point this thing...
primalmagick.research.primal_hoe.title: Primal Hoe
primalmagick.research.primal_hoe.text.st: I wonder if I can improve my tools by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  A hoe is used to create farmland for plants, and they love the Sun.  Perhaps that will work.

Ritually aligning a primalite hoe to the Sun has resulted in an excellent farming implement.
When used on any plant matter, it will act like bone meal, fertilizing it and encouraging rapid growth. Doing so damages the hoe, but it's still a marvelous ability. If I wish to suppress this property, I just have to use the hoe while sneaking.
The hoe doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.
primalmagick.research.primal_hoe.text.ad: I've learned how to recreate this hoe's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining Summon, Creature, and Sun runes, I can apply this enchantment to any hoe to allow it to speed plant growth.  Higher levels of the enchant will result in less damage to the hoe when I use it that way.
primalmagick.research.primal_pickaxe.tex: I wonder if I can improve my tools by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  The head of a pickaxe looks kind of like a crescent moon...  Maybe that's enough to establish a sympathetic link.

Ritually aligning a primalite pickaxe to the Moon has created a very efficient mining tool.
When used to dig up certain valuable minerals, the magick of the pickaxe has a very good chance of yielding bonus nuggets of that same type of ore.
The pickaxe doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this pickaxe's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining Summon, Item, and Moon runes, I can apply this enchantment to any digging tool to find bonus mineral nuggets.
I believe that I can increase the might of my weapons by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  Virtually any weapon could conceivably by aligned with the Blood, but I think I'm going to go with a trident.  Blood flows like water, after all.

Ritually aligning a hexium trident to the Blood has yielded an exceedingly deadly polearm.
Creatures struck with it will be unable to stop bleeding for a few seconds, and the intensity of the blood loss will increase with subsequent strikes.
The trident doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this trident's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining the Project, Creature, and Blood runes, I can apply this enchantment to any trident, sword, or axe to let it rend and tear at my foes' flesh.
primalmagick.research.forbidden_bow.text: I believe that I can increase the might of my weapons by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  For the Infernal, I choose to align a bow.  The power of damned souls will propel my arrows.

Ritually aligning a hexium bow to the Infernal has resulted in a most peculiar weapon.
Creatures struck by its arrows will be pierced both body and soul, and the resulting soul fragments will drop as soul gem slivers. Only the first ranged strike on a creature will result in a soulpierce, and some powerful creatures are immune to the effect.
The bow doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this bow's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining the Absorb, Creature, and Infernal runes, I can apply this enchantment to any bow or crossbow to allow it to wound my targets in their very souls.
primalmagick.research.forbidden_sword.te: I believe that I can increase the might of my weapons by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  The blade cuts through air, leaving only emptiness in its wake, making it a perfect vessel for the Void.

Ritually aligning a hexium sword to the Void has resulted in a very hungry blade.
Creatures killed by it will have a portion of their essence consumed, dropping as dust for me to collect. Some powerful creatures are immune to the effect.
The sword doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this sword's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining the Summon, Item, and Void runes, I can apply this enchantment to any trident, sword, or axe to allow it to consume my foes' very essence.
primalmagick.research.sacred_shield.text: I should be able to empower my tools by ritually aligning them with a primal source.  The Hallowed is a source of purity and protection, making a shield the natural choice for alignment.

Ritually aligning a hallowsteel shield to the Hallowed has created a superlative defensive implement.
Normal shields can only block certain types of incoming attacks, like swords or arrows. This shield, however, will reduce the damage I take from *all* sources for as long as I'm blocking with it, even things that a shield couldn't normally save me from.
This protection isn't quite instant, ramping up over time as I block, but it's pretty fast. It fades as soon as I drop my guard, though.
The shield doesn't seem to want to take on any other enchantments, though. Maybe I'll find a way around that in the future.

I've learned how to recreate this shield's special properties using a rune enchantment.  By combining the Protect, Self, and Hallowed runes, I can apply this enchantment to any shield to increase its defensive potential.
primalmagick.research.dream_vision_talis:
I find myself concerned about the number of Observations I'll be able to make. It's getting harder and harder to find materials that I haven't analyzed already, and my theorycrafting work requires a steady stream of them.
If only there were a way to harness the breadth of life experiences I've gained. That might be a solution.

This should do nicely. I've designed a talisman that will allow me to convert my experience into concrete Observations.
As long as the talisman is on my person, it will absorb any experience orbs that I pick up, drawing their knowledge into itself rather than my experience pool. Once it's full, the next time I sleep, the talisman will grant me a useful vision in my dreams, granting me a new Observation. Doing so damages the talisman, however, and will eventually cause it to break.
Should I decide that I don't want my talisman to absorb experience for a while, I can deactivate it by using it from my hand. I can reactivate it by using it again.
primalmagick.research.dowsing_rod.title: Dowsing Rod
primalmagick.research.dowsing_rod.text.s:
Rituals are complicated, and laying out my altar space correctly seems very important to success, according to my Grimoire.
Doing this by eye and the seat of my pants strikes me as a path to disaster. I need a tool that will give me feedback on the quality of my altar layout before I attempt a ritual.

Well, it's simple, but I think it will do the job.
Waving this dowsing rod at a ritual altar will give me a rough idea of how stable my current ritual layout is. In addition, waving it at a prop or an offering pedestal will give me feedback on its placement.
I mustn't forget, however, that a complex ritual can quickly overwhelm even a very good layout if I'm not quick and efficient in stepping through the process.
primalmagick.research.basic_magitech.tex:
I think I'm starting to get the hang of Magitech. The devices are just like normal machines, except they run on mana instead of redstone.
I've drawn up schematics for set of simple, replaceable parts that I can use when designing enchanted machinery. No doubt more advanced devices will need something more intricate, but it's a start!
primalmagick.research.expert_magitech.te: My skill with magitech is growing, but I need more practice with it before I can get over this plateau I'm on.  Nothing to do but keep at it.
I now feel comfortable calling myself an expert at designing magitech devices.  Now I can start researching more advanced machines and continue my studies.
primalmagick.research.master_magitech.te: My skill with magitech is growing, but I need more practice with it before I can get over this plateau I'm on.  Nothing to do but keep at it.
I've now mastered conventional magitech and have started researching the forbidden topics that my Grimoire remains silent about.
primalmagick.research.supreme_magitech.t: The top of the hill is in sight.  My skills with magitech are almost without peer...  Almost.
The most advanced topics in the discipline of magitech are now at my fingertips.
primalmagick.research.honey_extractor.te: Honey is delicious and sweet, and I wish there was a way to get it more efficiently from hives.  There's more of it in honeycombs than I can get from a bottle, but it's trapped inside the wax.  Can magick help?

I've devised a simple device that should help me extract the honey my sweet tooth craves. It spins the honeycombs very fast, causing the cells of the comb to rupture and spill their honey. While such a device would conceivably be possible without magick, I found that powering it with Sky mana made the design much simpler.
To begin, I'll need a honeycomb and an empty glass bottle. The extractor will also need to be powered with a small amount of Sky mana, which can be done by placing a wand in the designated slot.
The machine will then process the honeycomb over several seconds, resulting in a bottle of honey and a clean clump of beeswax that I may be able to repurpose.
primalmagick.research.seascribe_pen.text: Working at my research table requires a lot of writing, and it feels like my quill is always running out of ink.  I spend more time dipping than I do writing!  Maybe there's a better way.

Oh, now this is elegant. I've designed a magitech pen which will let me work at my research table much better.
The pen is loaded with the same enchanted ink that I use already, but the tiny magitech device embedded within causes it to slowly pull Sea mana from the environment. It's not much, but it's more than enough to replenish my ink supply.
The result is a pen that never runs dry, no matter how much I write. And it's very pleasing to hold, to boot. Functional and stylish both!
primalmagick.research.arcanometer.title: Arcanometer
primalmagick.research.arcanometer.text.s:
Analyzing items is tedious, exacting work, and it's a destructive process. I'm always hesitant to analyze anything valuable because I don't want to lose it.
Is there a way I can overcome these limitations?

I'm feeling very proud of myself right now. Behold, the Arcanometer!
Rather than spending an afternoon hunched over an analysis table, I can simply take the Arcanometer, point it at a block, and trigger it. Presto, one detailed scan result.
I can even use it to scan creatures now! For obvious reasons, they'd never let me take them apart under a magnifying glass, but now I don't have to. I should just make sure not to let them eat me while I'm scanning them.
primalmagick.research.primalite_golem.te:
Golems are fascinating creatures. They're animated, but clearly not alive. Magickal, but they don't seem to use mana.
Is this a result that I can replicate with magitech?

I've succeeded in creating my own version of an iron golem out of Primalite. The resulting entity is tougher, faster, and smarter than a conventional iron golem.
To create the golem, I must take a golem controller, place it atop a T-shape of Primalite blocks, and then activate the controller with a wand. The resulting golem will recognize me as its master, following me around and defending me from attack. If I want it to stop following me, for whatever reason, I can command it to stay by right-clicking on it.
Should my golem become severely damaged, I can repair it by using an ingot of Primalite on it.
The magick that binds the golem to me is tenuous, and I can only have a single golem servant at a time. Should I attempt to create a second one, the first will be destroyed.
primalmagick.research.hexium_golem.title: Hexium Golem
My research into Primalite golems was a success, but I suspect that I can improve upon it by using Hexium as a base material.  The programming will need to updated, of course, but that should be no issue for a mage of my skill.

Brilliant! My new Hexium golem servant is stronger and tougher than its predecessor, and immune to the ravages of flame to boot.
It is created in a similar method as Primalite golems, only using an updated golem controller and a base of Hexium blocks. Also similar to other metallic golems, I can repair this one using an ingot of Hexium.
I can still only have a single active golem servant at a time, though. No matter, the previous model is obsolete and can be disposed of.
Enlightenment may be a shield of a sort, but it won't stop me from being eaten by a hungry zombie. That said, I can see the hatred in the eyes of my Hexium golem, and it saddens me.
Let me share the song of the universe with my creation.

I've devised perhaps my greatest magitech creation. Created from the purest Hallowsteel blocks and the most intricate controller I've ever designed, this golem will guard me from the forces of darkness.
It is stronger and tougher than its predecessor, untouchable by flame, and immune to the consumptive effects of the wither. Should it be necessary, I can repair it with an ingot of Hallowsteel.
One golem remains all that can follow me, but with this by my side, one should be all I need.
primalmagick.research.concocting_tinctur:
Potions are great, but bulky. I have to down an entire bottle to get any effect out of them, and then fumble in my backpack to replace it.
Can I use magick to improve them?

It turns out that I can, in fact, improve my potions using the magickal arts.
By combining the usual brewing ingredients with a handful of the appropriate dust essence, I can concentrate the effects of the potion into a more dense concoction. These tinctures hold three doses of potion per flask, compared to the usual one dose per bottle.
The concocter device can only whip up a single tincture at a time, and it needs to be powered with Infernal mana to generate the necessary heat, but that's fine. I'm just glad to have my bag space back!
Some tincture recipes require the use of Blood essence.
Some tincture recipes require the use of Infernal essence.
primalmagick.research.concocting_philter: Tinctures are the work of an amateur.  A mage of my prodigious skill can do better.

And better I have done.
By substituting shard essence for the dust used in a tincture, I can create even more potent concoctions. These philters carry six doses of potion per flask.
Philter recipes will use triple the amount of Infernal mana in the concocter, but that's a small price to pay for such potency.
Some philter recipes require the use of Blood essence.
Some philter recipes require the use of Infernal essence.
primalmagick.research.concocting_elixirs: Potency is an illusion.  Each drop of potion carries within it the entire memory of what it must do, it need only be reminded how.

Apparently what those drops of potion need to jog their memory is more essence. A crystal, to be precise.
The resulting elixirs contain nine full doses of potion per flask. I must be careful not to accidentally overindulge with such tiny sips needed.
The mana necessary to prepare these elixirs has again tripled, but that is alright; mana is not some treasure to be hoarded, after all.
Some elixir recipes require the use of Blood essence.
Some elixir recipes require the use of Infernal essence.
primalmagick.research.concocting_bombs.t:
Some potions just aren't meant to be drunk, at least by oneself. Or perhaps meant to be shared?
Either way, skyglass flasks don't shatter like the regular glass bottles in splash potions do. And even if they did, who wants to waste all those doses of potion at once?
I must devise a new method of distribution.

Bombs! Bombs are great!
By creating a set of special bomb casings, I can distribute individual doses of potion to anyone at range. A single set of casings will produce six bombs.
Alchemical bombs don't just explode on impact, necessarily. I mean, they will if you score a direct hit on a creature, but if you miss, they'll bounce. Bombs are on a timed fuse and will detonate when that time runs out. I can change the length of the fuse by using it while sneaking.
Some bomb recipes requires the use of Blood essence.
Some bomb recipes requires the use of Infernal essence.
Some bomb recipes requires the use of Void essence.
primalmagick.research.entropy_sink.title: Entropy Sink
Ritual magick is dangerous stuff, I've learned.  Even the simplest ritual can destabilize quickly.  Perhaps I can design a device to make them safer?

I've designed a machine that will capture stray magickal energies in the environment and convert them to harmless light.
The machine functions like a normal ritual prop, but one that can be used with any ritual. To activate it, I must use a unit of magickal essence on the device when the ritual calls for it; if I do it before then, the machine will have no effect. Once activated, it will generate a burst of stability and allow the ritual to progress, with more potent essence yielding greater stability gains.
Unlike most props, the entropy sink does not have to be manually reset. It does, however, require a minute to cool back down after use and cannot be used in a ritual again until then.
primalmagick.research.auto_charger.title: Auto-Charger
As my wands can hold more mana, keeping them charged has become a challenge. Even with mana fonts at home, it can take minutes of channeling to get one to full.
I have an idea for something to ease this process...

My newest device is similar to a Wand Charger, but rather than consuming essence it will automatically siphon from nearby fonts.
Only one wand can be held in the charger at a time, and it only has a range of five blocks, but it can pull from multiple fonts at once.
Best of all, I can just drop the wand in and walk away to do other things while it works. I think this is going to save me a lot of time.
primalmagick.research.essence_transmuter:
Managing my essence stocks is a tricky feat. Earth essence appears to be in almost everything, while some other sources are much harder to come by.
I wonder if there's anything I can do to help balance this out.

I've designed a new magitech device that I call an Essence Transmuter. It utilizes the protean magick of the Moon to convert one source of essence into another source.
The process is a very lossy one, though. Currently it takes eight units of the same type of essence to produce one unit of another type of essence. In addition, the source of essence that I get back is random, beyond my control.
Like some other devices, the Essence Transmuter requires a certain amount of configuration. It's not difficult, and I can do it automatically as part of placing the block, but it does mean that another mage's transmuter won't be set up precisely like my own. Results could be unpredictable.
primalmagick.research.dissolution_chambe:
Even using an Earthshatter Hammer, my works present an untenable demand upon my mineral stocks. There must be a way to stretch my stores even further.
I have more important things to do than dig in the dirt like some peasant!

Brilliant! With the careful application of Earth mana, I can now precisely dissolve select types of mineral. The end result of this process is a larger amount of pure metals to be smelted into ingots.
I can also utilize this process to break down stone into ever-finer particles with minimal loss of mass. Very useful for when I need to create large quantities of sand for glazing. There may even be other things that I can dissolve this way.
primalmagick.research.zephyr_engine.text: Larger machines are often focused on moving things around, but pistons are so short-ranged and water canals are messy.  Perhaps I can design a machine to generate a strong wind to accomplish the same thing, but better?

Action at a distance doesn't have to be magickal, though the magick does make it a lot cooler. This new Zephyr Engine will push any items or creatures in front of it away.
The engine's output scales with the strength of the redstone signal it receives as input. Stronger signals will result in more powerful wind that reaches farther away and pushes things faster.
primalmagick.research.void_turbine.title: Void Turbine
Sometimes I don't want to push things away, but rather to pull them in.  Whether into collection mechanisms or diabolical traps, I want none to escape my grasp.

Augmented with the power of the void, this wind current generator suits my needs. This new Void Turbine will pull any items or creatures in front of it towards itself.
The turbine's suction scales with the strength of the redstone signal it receives as input. Stronger signals will result in more powerful wind that reaches farther away and pulls things faster.
primalmagick.research.raw_marble.title: Marble
primalmagick.research.raw_marble.text.st:
Marble is a lovely variety of stone, but that's not what makes it so special. It synergizes with magick, reflecting, absorbing, or redirecting it at the will of the mage.
I can see why the ancients used marble to build their shrines. It will be very important in many of my workings.
primalmagick.research.hallowed_orb.title: Hallowed Orb
Now just what was such a powerful creature of darkness doing with this? The orb hums with a soothing power of a sort I've never felt before. And I do mean hum: I can feel, rather than hear, music in my heart when I hold it.
I want to see this power grow, see what it will become when mature. Perhaps if I infuse its energy into a tree sapling...
primalmagick.research.hallowood_trees.te:
Positively wondrous! To think that such beauty could be the end product of the cleansing rite I've undertaken.
These trees resonate with Hallowed energy, seeming to draw life from the very creative forces of the universe, rather than mere sunlight. Perhaps I could learn more by studying their essence.
Yes, that feels right. Nurturing life to gain knowledge. Perhaps this is a lesson in humility that I sorely need.
primalmagick.research.sunwood_trees.text:
These magickal trees wax and wane over time. During the day they're fully present, but at night they fade out to near invisibility.
They seem strongly aligned with the Sun, and could prove a useful source of essence of that type.
Alternately, I could make some tasteful decoration with it. The wood loses its phasing properties with too much processing, though.
primalmagick.research.moonwood_trees.tex:
These magickal trees wax and wane over time. During the night they're fully present, but in they daytime they fade out to near invisibility.
They seem strongly aligned with the Moon, and could prove a useful source of essence of that type.
Alternately, I could make some tasteful decoration with it. The wood loses its phasing properties with too much processing, though.
primalmagick.research.rock_salt.title: Rock Salt
primalmagick.research.rock_salt.text.sta:
Ah, salt. This delicious mineral can be found all over the place.
Rock salt needs to be refined in a furnace before it's of much use, though. The Grimoire seems to hint that it has interesting interactions with magick, but doesn't go into detail.
In time, perhaps I will learn more. Until then, I can use it to season my food to make it tastier and more filling!
primalmagick.research.alchemical_waste.t:
Oh, gross. What is this garbage? It's not essence, that's for sure.
I thought I had my equipment properly configured to process every type of magickal essence there was. Perhaps this waste is an indicator that I haven't learned as much as I think.
I should keep an eye out for objects bearing unknown magickal signatures. Save them for later, maybe. This gunk, on the other hand, I can definitely throw out.
primalmagick.research.quartz.title: Quartz
Curious...
I've heard tell of this mineral quartz before, but I was always under the impression that it wasn't found in the Overworld. Guess I was wrong.
Notes in the Grimoire have taught me techniques to carve up a single piece of quartz into multiple slivers. This should allow me to use it sparingly as needed.
primalmagick.research.inner_demon.title: Inner Demon
primalmagick.research.inner_demon.text.s:
Wow... I'm not sure whether it was brave or foolish of me to scan that thing instead of fighting or running, but I got a clear read, at least. As I suspected, this creature is an amalgam of my darkest impulses, twisted and empowered by forbidden magick.
There doesn't seem to be a safe way to fight this thing. Its fists are infused with the Infernal, meaning that it will set me aflame with every strike. But if I'm out of range of that, it will instead lash out with Blood magick, ignoring my armor and tearing me apart from the inside.
Worst of all, perhaps, is its mastery of Void magick. Every so often, it will use that to summon a Sin Crystal which will steadily heal it until destroyed. But the crystals project a damaging magickal aura which will hurt me if I get too close to them. I'll have to deal with those quickly and carefully.
primalmagick.research.bookshelf.title: Bookshelf
primalmagick.research.bookshelf.text.sta:
If there's one thing a mage can never have enough of, it's books. That and places to store them.
Many of the books I come across will contain reference material valuable in my work. A bookshelf would make a valuable research aid for my research table.
primalmagick.research.beehive.title: Beehive
primalmagick.research.beehive.text.stage:
Look at those little bugs go! Their movements are hypnotic, and I can't help but feel like there may be a greater meaning in their seeming chaos.
Maybe a beehive would make a good research aid for my research table?
primalmagick.research.beacon.title: Beacon
It may not be tied to any of the primal sources, but this thing is definitely magickal. I could write a book on the study of its emanations and their effects.
This would definitely make a valuable research aid for my research table.
primalmagick.research.dragon_egg.title: Dragon Egg
primalmagick.research.dragon_egg.text.st:
This egg is more than just a trophy. If my analysis is correct, it's a powerful magickal artifact in its own right.
I wonder what I could learn if I used it as a research aid for my research table?
primalmagick.research.dragon_head.title: Dragon Head
primalmagick.research.dragon_head.text.s:
A strange vitality courses through this dragon head. While definitely dead, it still seems to hunger for... something.
Perhaps I can utilize this deathless hunger as a research aid somehow?
primalmagick.research.mystical_relic.tex:
It appears the ancients left more than just shrines behind. They also left knowledge in the form of inscribed stone tablets.
Of course, finding an intact one seems impossible. I'll have to assemble these relics from fragments that I recover in the world.
Studying a completed relic will reveal to me a new theory! Or, if I need the emeralds, a Librarian villager might be interested in buying them from me.

primalmagick.dream_journal.title: Dream Journal
primalmagick.dream_journal.text.1:
"I dreamed of the shrine last night. The same strange energy still permeated the air, but this time I knew the word for it.

Magick.

As if the word unlocked something in my mind, I knew what to do. In the dream, I dug beneath the base of"
primalmagick.dream_journal.text.2:
"the shrine and found stone laced with a curious dust. Sensing more magick within it, I took a handful of the dust and rubbed it onto an ordinary stick.

So imbued, the stick became something more. In the dream, I took it and waved it at a bookcase."
primalmagick.dream_journal.text.3:
"The dream ended before I could see what resulted, but I feel like it would have been something wondrous.

I feel like this could be a key to something amazing, if I just have the courage to take that first step."

primalmagick.attunement.earth.text:
Minor attunement to the Earth source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Earth mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Earth will grant me increased stamina, allowing me to swing swords and tools faster without tiring.
Finally, greater attunement to the Earth will cause the very ground to rise beneath my feet when I walk, allowing me to step up the full height of a block without needing to jump.
primalmagick.attunement.sea.text:
Minor attunement to the Sea source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Sea mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Sea will grant me the grace of a dolphin, greatly increasing my swim speed.
Finally, greater attunement to the Sea will allow me to breathe water as if it were air.
primalmagick.attunement.sky.text:
Minor attunement to the Sky source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Sky mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Sky will infuse me with speed and dexterity, increasing my movement speed and greatly reducing any fall damage I take.
Finally, greater attunement to the Sky truly allows me to soar. While it won't truly let me fly, I'll be able to jump higher, and even jump a second time while in midair.
primalmagick.attunement.sun.text:
Minor attunement to the Sun source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Sun mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Sun will allow me to draw nourishment from it like a plant, filling my belly so long as I'm outdoors during the daytime.
Finally, greater attunement to the Sun grants me true radiance. Whenever I'm in a dark area, I'll have a chance to create lasting light in my wake. Should I not desire this to happen, I need only sneak.
primalmagick.attunement.moon.text:
Minor attunement to the Moon source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Moon mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Moon will let me defensively wrap myself in shifting illusions, giving me a chance to become invisible whenever I take damage.
Finally, greater attunement to the Moon allows me to become one with the night, seeing through the darkness as if it were day.
primalmagick.attunement.blood.text:
Minor attunement to the Blood source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Blood mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Blood will let me exsanguinate my foes, causing them to bleed for more damage whenever I score a solid hit on one. All except for the loathsome undead, that is, who have no blood to shed.
Finally, greater attunement to the Blood will cause me to siphon my enemies' life force, granting me a chance to heal my wounds as I harm them.
primalmagick.attunement.infernal.text:
Minor attunement to the Infernal source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Infernal mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Infernal will let me lash out with a Hellish Chain when I strike, dealing bonus fire damage to the next-closest victim to my original target.
Finally, greater attunement to the Infernal will let me become one with the flames, and immune to their ravages.
primalmagick.attunement.void.text:
Minor attunement to the Void source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Void mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Void will infuse my flesh with nothingness, reducing all damage I take.
Finally, greater attunement to the Void will channel the hunger of the eldritch through my attacks, granting them all increased potency.
primalmagick.attunement.hallowed.text:
Minor attunement to the Hallowed source makes it easier to channel mana. In practice, I'll pay 5% less Hallowed mana for all purposes.
Lesser attunement to the Hallowed will make me anathema to the undead, doubling all damage I deal to them.
Finally, greater attunement to the Hallowed will empower my soul such that, when fatally wounded, I will not die but live on. Such an effort will weaken my soul for a short time, preventing such a miracle from happening again until I recover.

primalmagick.research_project.text.trade: Perhaps some nearby villagers have magickal knowledge to trade.  You assemble some goods they'll find valuable.
primalmagick.research_project.text.munda: You spend some time working with your tools, creating paraphernalia to help with your magickal pursuits.
primalmagick.research_project.text.redst: You spend some time tinkering with your redstone devices, seeing if their principles will help your magitech studies.
primalmagick.research_project.text.exped: Who knows what arcane secrets lie hidden in the dungeons of the world?  You prepare an expedition to find some.
primalmagick.research_project.text.nethe: The fortresses of the Nether are surely filled with forbidden knowledge.  You prepare an expedition to find some.
primalmagick.research_project.text.recup: Too much work dulls the mind.  Perhaps an idea will strike you if you take some time to stop and smell the roses.
primalmagick.research_project.text.essen: Magickal essence has many amazing properties.  You study some to see how it reacts with other substances.
primalmagick.research_project.text.brewi: There are many similarities between brewing and wizardly alchemy.  Perhaps studying the former will give you insight into the latter.
primalmagick.research_project.text.wand_: You experiment with different methods and materials for constructing wands, hoping to refine your understanding of the process.
primalmagick.research_project.text.spell: You devise and cast some simple spells, hoping to refine your technique.  Practice makes perfect, after all.
primalmagick.research_project.text.advan: Analysis of basic magickal essence was rewarding.  It stands to reason that more advanced essence structures will teach you even more.
primalmagick.research_project.text.encha: Enchanting and manaweaving are close siblings.  Studying their similarities and differences could be enlightening.
primalmagick.research_project.text.obser: A more thorough analysis of your observations may yield surprising discoveries.
primalmagick.research_project.text.hit_t: There's bound to be something in all of this reading material that would be useful in your studies.
primalmagick.research_project.text.beaco: While they're not of the wizardly arts, Beacons are clearly more than just mundane objects.  Studying their emanations could be valuable.
primalmagick.research_project.text.porta: Strange things sometimes come back through Nether portals.  You could learn much by studying them.
primalmagick.research_project.text.draco: This egg seems to harmonize with ender pearls, releasing intriguing energies.  Is this really such a good idea, though?
primalmagick.research_project.text.pigli: The piglins of the Nether must surely know secrets about that infernal place.  Exploit their craving for gold.
primalmagick.research_project.text.apiam: Some say you can see the future in the movement of bees.  It's probably overstated, but you might still learn something.
primalmagick.research_project.text.end_e: The cities of The End reek of secrets.  You prepare an expedition to brave their dangers and bring some home.
primalmagick.research_project.text.maste: Study of magickal essence has been profitable for you.  It's time to learn what the purest samples have to teach.
primalmagick.research_project.text.draco: This dragon hoarded experiences, not gold.  Even in death it hungers for more.  Feed it, and see what it can teach you.
